#----------------------- def longProcess(tagPath = tagPath, val = currentValue.value): import ils.io.wrapper as wrapper wrapper.write(tagPath, val) #-----------------------
if currentValue.value != "": system.util.invokeAsynchronous(longProcess)

#----------------------- def longProcess(tagPath = tagPath, val = currentValue.value): import ils.io.wrapper as wrapper wrapper.write(tagPath, val) #-----------------------
if currentValue.value != "": system.util.invokeAsynchronous(longProcess)

"""
"""
# Only process the value on the rising edge, the falling edge is the reset if currentValue.value == True: from ils.labData.selector import valueChanged valueChanged(tagPath)

Tag.name: automatedDownload
Tag.Property: True means fully automatic, False means display recipe screen

EventScripts.Event:
#----------------------- def longProcess(tagPath = tagPath, val = currentValue.value): from ils.recipeToolkit.download import automatedDownloadHandler automatedDownloadHandler(tagPath, val) #-----------------------
# I'm not sure if it is a characteristic of my development system, or of OPC, or # of my Kepware OPC server, but whenever I restart my gateway this trigger fires as # if the OPC tag received a new value. Since it is highly unlikely for an # automated download to be requested at the same time as the gateway restarts this will # check to see that the system has been running for at least 30 seconds before # honoring any automated download requests. runningSeconds = system.tag.read("[~]Recipe/Constants/runningSeconds").value if runningSeconds != None and currentValue.value != "" and runningSeconds > 30: system.util.invokeAsynchronous(longProcess)

#----------------------- def longProcess(tagPath = tagPath, val = currentValue.value): import ils.io.wrapper as wrapper wrapper.writeRecipeDetail(tagPath, val) #-----------------------
if currentValue.value != "": system.util.invokeAsynchronous(longProcess)

"""
""" logger = system.util.getLogger("com.ils.opcDatasetCollector") logger.trace("OPC Dataset Collector: Inside Trigger Tag Event Scipt") udtTagPath = tagPath.strip("/Trigger Tag") from ils.opcDatasetCollector.triggerTag import setValues setValues(udtTagPath) logger.trace("OPC Dataset Cllector: Leaving Trigger Tag Event Script")
